description: Squad Kerbal Space Program is a popular rocket construction and space flight simulation game. It is available for many platforms, including Windows, macOS, and Linux.

The game stores a player's current game state, including all their in-progress flights, in a file named persistent.sfs . This file is a plain text file, which Kerbal Space Program modders can open and edit to make changes to their in-progress games. For example, a player can edit persistent.sfs to give themself more money.

Kerbal Space Program also allows players to create "quicksaves" of their game to revert back to previous game states. For example, a player might want to revert to a previous state if one of their rockets crashes. These quicksaves are named quicksave.sfs .

common_filenames.description: persistent.sfs - Stores a player's saved game; can be loaded by selecting Resume Saved .
quicksave.sfs - A quicksave used to revert to a previous game state.
